title: Remove Sunfire from tank jungler recommended items
body: I realize it only takes a few seconds to figures out the passives don't stack. But I feel its intentionally misleading to put both of them as essential items. Nice noob trap ya got there.

KInd of awkward when I have to tell my friend to not buy sunfire because his jungle item does the same thing.

You can also run Ohmwrecker as a health + armor item. The stats are pretty solid (very comparable to the stats that Sunfire Cape gives), so even if you don't use the active you aren't really wasting a whole lot of gold to get it.

I've personally started trying it out a bit in patch 5.4, but I never felt like it ever matched Sunfire Cape in terms of effectiveness, but if you took it into the context of the jungle, where the Cinderhulk enchantment makes Sunfire Cape unreasonable, it is a pretty solid alternative.

Example: Amumu jungle tank.

You won't build Ohmwrecker on Amumu. It is made for split pushing with the passive it has.  He does not split push, his kit is horrible for split pushing and it is not worth taking up a whole item slot for stats with small numbers compared to other tank items.  It only has 300 health, that's not that much compared to other tank items with health 450+.  So, no Ohmwrecker.  It is good on bruisers, like Jax or Yorick, or anyone who is trying to split push and has some attack speed and attack damage and can destroy turrets quickly, because of it's passive, but not on pure tanks.  Sunfire cape had 450 health and 45 armor, and with the 25% bonus health increase on the jungle tank item, it makes it worth even more health.  So, the numbers are just way too small to be useful much for a tank IMO.  For a bruiser looking to split push it works great though.

My suggestion?  They need some new tank items.  They need a new armor health item, and they need a new MR/health item.  Besides the 2 they  have for support (Banner and Aegis) tanks only have SV and Banshee.  There isn't a whole of diversity in this niche, especially since tanks need health with all the % penetration that carries build.

OW also has 50 armor, which is 5 more than Sunfire Cape, not to mention it also has 10% cooldown reduction and conditional movement speed off of the point runner passive, which are absolutely amazing on just about any tank. 

What is also worth noting is that even though Sunfire Cape has more health for Cinderhulk, the Cinderhulk passive also makes the lower health that Ohmwrecker provides less of a weakness. There is still the weakness, but at the same time the weakness isn't as prominent.

You know you can buy Frozen heart on manaless champions... you get all the same combat stats... not like you are going to run out of mana anyways so not like it matters that you don't get any mana from it...

But I want an item with health and armor, besides Randuin's, that I can build when I tank jungle.  That is the only item I can build.  There is no diversity.  It is the only option for tanks like Amumu, who have no use for Ohmwrecker and who need higher stats than what it gives.  There needs to be more tank items, especially ones with health.  Previously, I would build the jungle item, boots, and then I had a choice: Randuin's or Sunfire. Now I don't.  And if I happen to need a little bit more armor, guess what?  I'm stuck building a 100 armor item when i really needed to put my gold towards 50 armor and 500 health, which would have been Sunfire.  

What's so wrong with asking Riot for a new tank item?  Is that so bad?

Plus, Frozen Heart has the same passive as Randuin's making is doubly bad for your manaless champs that get the two, and for me as well. There could be a better, more efficient way at itemization:  having a larger item selection.  Personally, I don't like having useless passives and stats, I like to utilize all my items stats.

Well yes some more items in general would be nice... 

And no... Randuin's and Frozen Heart does NOT have the same passive... so they fully stack and work perfectly fine with one another

Frozen Heart:
UNIQUE: Reduces the attack speed of nearby enemies by 15% (Unnamed unique passives work with all other passives other then the exact same one)

Randuin's Omen:
UNIQUE PASSIVE – COLD STEEL: When hit by basic attacks, reduces the attacker's attack speed by 15% for 1 second. (The only two items with "Cold steel" are Randuin's omen and Warden's mail... so there is no completed item Randuin's does not stack with... other then itself)

Depending on how much you need the armor (5/0 yi or just in anticipation against a pantheon) you can always build components of items to fit your needs. Urgent solution to a fed adc? Finish your thornmail/FH and rush 2 ruby crystals for some hp padding (which will turn into either Aegis/Banshee's/Visage for your inevitable MR needs later) or a giant belt if you're after warmogs/randuins/sunfire and their ap isn't dangerously fed. 

If your need for 1 particular resist isn't urgent (or the worst situation of all, both AP/AD are fed in which case there isn't much you can do anyway), you can buy pieces of all of them and gradually upgrade them at your own pace (e.g. cloth -> chainmail -> null mantle -> spectre's cowl -> giant belt -> finish one of the items then finish the other. 

I do think Randuins + FH rush is overkill (unless you have the  big bad adc situation) and will leave you extremely vulnerable to magic. One does not need to buy mixed items, because pure armor and pure hp items exist. You can even buy 1 full armor, 1 hp/armor and 2 hp/mr items and get decently mixed resists with sufficient hp. Best thing of all? The components of these items (minus giant belt) are quite small and you can get pieces of them gradually especially if the need is urgent.

Randuins + FH could be alright against an all AD team especially if they rely on attack speed

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMoe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AtXKE4E8,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-03-14T02:39:38.463+0000)
>
> pardon the noob question...but which passives dont stack?

UNIQUE passive with a name don't stack if the passives have the same name.  E.g. Sheen, Triforce, Lich Bane, IBG.

UNIQUE passives without a name won't stack with themselves.  So no buying 5 Warmogs and regenning ridiculous amounts of health, or multiple Black Cleavers for 100% armor shred (actually there was a bug at one point where this worked.  It was... bad.)

And yes, they should probably remove Sunfire from recommended builds that include Cinderhulk.
